hook.text: 'Ok.' Did they mean 'okay, great!' or 'okay, I'm furious'? A two-letter text launches an hour of anxiety.

buildup.text: Texts strip 93% of communication â€” no tone, no expression, no body language. Just raw, ambiguous words.

discovery.text: Studies show people interpret neutral texts as negative when they're already feeling insecure or anxious.

twist.text: Emojis were invented to solve this problem. But even emojis are interpreted differently across cultures and ages.

climax.text: Texting is a brilliant tool for logistics and a terrible one for emotions. Know when to call instead.

punchline.text: Texting removed tone from love. Misunderstandings filled the gap.

quiz.question: Why do texts often cause miscommunication in relationships?
options: Texts remove tone, expression, and body language
